Package planning.actions

Class AttackActionType

  • java.lang.Object
    • planning.actions.AttackActionType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    burlap.mdp.core.action.ActionType
    public class AttackActionType
extends java.lang.Object
implements burlap.mdp.core.action.ActionType
    Description: This class implements the ActionType abstract class from burlap and is used to tell the planner what actions are possible to take at a givens state Why This Exists: To provide the ai planer with possible attacking actions. How to incorporate more options: in AllApplicableActions, add one or more attack actions with the new possible options. I recommend doing this with another for loop inside or encapsulating the existing ones to enumerate all the combinations of arguments.

    • Field Detail

      • whatOptions

        protected static final java.lang.String[] whatOptions
        An array of all possible arguments that can go in the "what=%s" part of a valid attack action's name. Done like this because one of them going to be valid if the others aren't. Additionally the AI Planner and reward function will decide which one is best, so even though sometimes these are bad options, it's not worth eliminating them here.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • allApplicableActions

        public java.util.List<burlap.mdp.core.action.Action> allApplicableActions​(burlap.mdp.core.state.State state)
        Given a state, enumerate all actions that can be taken by the bot. An important note for this and all similar functions is that the actual game of starcraft may not match this state because this is used by the planner to explore options. why it exists: The BWAPI needs a way to know what action it can take in a given plausable state. This function enumarates all of them based on the state given. how it works: Uses the current state to figure out what attack actions to tell the planner are possible via taking info from the state and creating all combinations.
        Specified by:
        allApplicableActions in interface burlap.mdp.core.action.ActionType
        Parameters:
        state - A BWAPI state, assumed to be specifically a PlanningState.
        Returns:
        A List of attack actions that may be taken.
